name: mainlined
content:

past simple and past participle of
mainline
[ I or T ] to inject (= put into the body through a needle) drugs directly into the blood: Several of her friends were mainlining heroin. By now she was mainlining.
[ T ] to eat, drink, buy, etc. large quantities of something as though you cannot get enough of it: Mainlining mulled wine and eating vast quantities of cheese, bread and chocolate is all part of the pleasure of skiing. Japan is a country that mainlines novelty.
